script-broken-pipe:
{{technical}}
Message displayed whenever a broken pipe occurs.
script-could-not-validate: Message displayed whenever the source code could not be validate due to errors.
script-doc-page-header:
Message displayed at the top of the documentation page. Parameters:
* $1 - the name of the programming language in which the corresponding script is written
$2 - the prefixed title of the script
script-doc-page-does-not-exist:
Message displayed if the documentation page does not exist. Parameters:
* $1 - the name of the programming language in which the script is written
$2 - the prefixed title of the doc page
script-doc-page-suffix: The page suffix (subpage) for script documentation pages.
script-engine-logo-indicator-alt-text: Alt-text of the logo indicator shown on pages in the Script namespace.
script-error-category:
{{tracking category name}}
Tracking category for pages with errors from #script.
script-error-category-desc: Description on [[Special:TrackingCategories]] for the {{msg-mw|script-error-category}} tracking category.
script-invalid-engine-specification-erro:
Error message displayed when trying to construct an engine from an invalid engine specification. Parameters:
* $1 - the name of the engine that the application tried to construct
* $2 - the reason for why the specification is invalid
script-invalid-engine-specification-reas: Reason displayed when an engine specification is invalid because of a missing attribute. Used as $2 in {{msg-mw|script-invalid-engine-specification-exception}}. Parameters: * $1 - the name of the attribute that is missing

Reason displayed when an engine specification is invalid because of the specified class does not exist. Used as $2 in {{msg-mw|script-invalid-engine-specification-exception}}. Parameters: * $1 - the name of the class that does not exist
script-missing-engine-error:
Error message displayed when the user tries to invoke a script for which no engine has been configured. Parameters:
* $1 - the name of the script the user tried to invoke
script-missing-engine-header: Message displayed if the engine needed to execute a script is missing.
script-missing-engine-indicator: Indicator shown when no engine is available for the script.
script-missing-function-name-error: Error message displayed when the user tries to invoke a script without specifying which function to invoke.
script-no-engine-error: Error message displayed at the top of the edit form when the user tries to save a script without a valid engine configured for the script's file extension.
script-no-such-engine-error:
Error message displayed when trying to construct an engine that does not exist. Parameters:
* $1 - the name of the engine that the application tried to construct
script-no-such-script-error:
Error message displayed when the user tries to invoke a script that does not exist. Parameters:
* $1 - the name of the script the user tried to invoke
script-python-runtime-error:
{{technical}} Error message displayed when a runtime error occurred while running a Python script. Parameters:
* $1 - the exception message given by Python
script-python-syntax-error:
{{technical}} Error message displayed when a syntax error occurred while compiling a Python script. Parameters:
* $1 - the syntax error given by Python
script-python-human-name: {{notranslate}} The human readable name of the Python programming language.
script-python-open-process-error:
Error message displayed when the Python engine process could not be opened. Parameters:
* $1 - the path to the engine file
* $2 - the Python executable that was used
* $3 - the error that was emitted by PHP
script-python-missing-proc-open-error:
Error message displayed when the PHP function <tt>proc_open</tt> is not available. <tt>proc_open</tt> is a PHP function name and <tt>disable_functions</tt> is the name of a PHP configuration. Both these names aren't localized and should not be translated.

See also:
* proc_open: https://www.php.net/manual/en/function.proc-open.php
* disable_functions: https://www.php.net/manual/en/ini.core.php
script-error-prefix: Prefix appended to error messages shown when the invocation of a script (through the #script parser function) failed.
content-model-script: Name for the script content model, used when describing what type of content a page contains.
